FuncDef:
The vsi-id command sets a VSI ID.
The undo vsi-id command deletes a VSI ID.
By default, no ID is set for a VSI.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VSI.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The ID of each VSI is unique on a device.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a VSI uses the LDP signaling, the VSI ID must be set.
The IDs of the VSIs in the same VPLS domain must be consistent.
Configuration Impact
A VSI ID uniquely identifies a VSI. The VSIs with the same VSI ID belong to one VPLS domain.
Follow-up Procedure
You can specify a peer for the VSI only after the VSI ID is set.
Precautions
The ID of each VSI must be unique on a device.If the IDs of the VSIs at the two ends of a PW are different and the peer command is run to specify the peer, specify the negotiation-vc-id parameter so that the same VSI ID is used at the two ends. Otherwise, PW negotiation fails.
